sideWeb.enContent:
Today, water is easily accessible in Taiwan, but few realize that this is the result of the continual consolidation of water resources over the years. 
During the Qing Dynasty, the natural environment was something to be “used”.

In the period of Japanese rule, it was something to be “changed” using the technology available to them. 
Today, impacted by the increase in environmental awareness, more importance is attached to water resources and our symbiotic relationship with the environment. 
The administrative district under the Taiwan Prefecture during the period of Japanese rule included the areas that are now Yunlin, Chiayi, and Tainan. 

By studying unpublished water resource maps and historical information archived at the Chianan and Yunlin Irrigation Associations (Today’s Chianan and Yunlin Management Offices, Irrigation Agency, Ministry of Agriculture), we have come to understand the relationship between water space, water resources, and local communities.

Work on the the Wushantou Reservoir & Chianan Irrigation WaterwayChianan Irrigation Waterway began in 1920. 
The year 2024 is the centennial of the opening up of the main waterway called “Cho waterway” in the Yunlin area, the first part of the irrigation system to be completed. 
2023 marks the 50th year since the completion of the Zengwen Reservoir, the largest in Taiwan. Important for communities residing in Taiwan’s southwestern plain, water resource projects like these can be viewed as a microcosm of water resource development in Taiwan.
     
The National Museum of Taiwan History is holding this exhibition at a time when the world is faced with climate change as a means to increase awareness of changes in the water environment. As you walk around the exhibition, we ask that you keep three questions in mind: First, where does the water that flows out of your faucet come from? Second, have you ever wondered if the waterway closest to your house is natural or a manmade drainage ditch or a irrigation waterway? Third, when you look around the world at areas that straddle the Tropic of Cancer, most consist of dry deserts, but southwestern Taiwan, which also lies alongside the Tropic of Cancer, is the nation’s breadbasket. Why is that? We take these things for granted, but should we?

In 2020-2023, the museum conducted a cross-domain study on the issue of the water resource and irrigation development  of Taiwan’s southwestern plain to get a fresh perspective on the water environment, an area of study that has been undervalued, and present a new understanding of the water environment from an historical viewpoint. 
In addition to looking at the development of water resources and the communities over the years, those engaged in water resource projects in Taiwan, and discerning the relationship between water resource projects and the environment, we also noted that the development of the water resource system relied on specialized knowledge and technology based on a complex knowledge system built up over time. 
In the end, the museum proposed the idea that water resources served to form local society and individuals.

sideWeb.enTitle: Qing Dynasty “water resource communities” built on “using” the natural environment
sideWeb.zhContent: 臺灣水利發展是持續整合的過程。清代利用私有埤圳進行水利開發與經營，以烏山頭水庫所在的官田、六甲與麻豆淺山及平原地區為例，本區域屬急水溪水系流域，因清代國家力量對於地方的控制力較弱，水利設施大多為民間自行籌設，私有埤圳遍佈，漢人社群也自成一套水資源分配制度。清代社會是利用自然環境的地型條件，發展小型水利社會。
sideWeb.enContent:
The development of water resources in Taiwan has been a process that has taken place over time. During the Qing Dynasty, privately-owned ponds and waterway were built and used. 
Take, for example, the hills and plains of Guantian, Liujia, and Madou where the Wutoushan Reservoir is located. 
Situated in the Jishui River drainage basin, private citizens planned and constructed most water resource undertakings, because the Qing government was not closely engaged with local communities. Privately-owned ponds and waterway were common. 
Han Chinese communities developed water resource distribution systems. 

During the Qing Dynasty, communities developed small-scale “water resource communities” taking advantage of natural topographical features.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 「改造」環境的日本時代水利社會
sideWeb.enTitle: Japanese era “water resource communities” based on “transforming” the natural environment
sideWeb.zhContent:
日本時代初期，總督府發現傳統臺灣水的使用權利多為私人所有的現象，乃由「公共埤圳組合」單位調查清代既有埤圳，再加以整併為區域型的水利系統。特別是各地糖廠，總督府為發展糖業，在各地設置原料區，由政府買斷清代埤圳，除延續使用既有水路外，也新設排水路，透過測量、統計及水利技術等，予以改善既有排水不良的低窪地，也改良土質、增加種植面積，並進行新舊水路整併。

這時期已呈現區域水利相連的雛形。而 1920 年開工的嘉南大圳，則是用科學技術改造環境的具體案例。
sideWeb.enContent:
In the early years of Japanese rule, the colonial government realized that water rights were monopolized by a few private owners, so it set up the Public Chianan Irrigation Waterway Cooperative Office responsible for investigating ponds and waterwayswaterway inherited from the Qing Dynasty and consolidating them into regional water resource systems. 
To help sugar factories and develop the island’s sugar industry, government authorities set up areas for the system of gathering sugarcane origins and bought up private ponds and waterways. 

In addition to continuing to use existent waterways, the government established new drainage channels and employed surveying, statistics, and water resource technology to improve the poor drainage conditions of low-lying areas, enhanced the soil, increased the amount of arable land, and consolidated old and new waterways. 
Connections among regional water resources were already taking shape.

The Chianan Irrigation WaterwayChianan Irrigation Waterway, the construction work of which was launched in 1920, is a concrete example of science and technology being used to transform the environment.

sideWeb.zhContent:
當今全球受氣候變遷影響及環境意識抬頭，臺灣水利思維從人定勝天的觀念，開始加入與環境共存、倡導水資源多次利用的永續觀。特別在作為臺灣河川、水庫開發及農業用水單位，水利人的用水觀念改變尤為明顯。

水利開發單位在開發下也進行環境補救措施，如推動水文化、在河道中設魚道或棲地復育等，並審慎評估水庫興建需要，農業單位如農田水利署雲林管理處以工程方法，在灌溉渠道中增加蓄水，以及回歸水再利用，使一滴水可重覆使用 6 次；水庫管理單位協助農田進行精進灌溉的節水規劃，都是水利單位對環境與水資源永續利用的具體表現。
sideWeb.enContent:
Today, in an era of climate change and increased environmental awareness, the thinking driving the development of water resources in Taiwan is shifting from the idea of mankind conquering nature to one of living in harmony with the environment and sustainable development with water being used multiple times. 
Changes in thinking about water usage is most notable among those engaged in the development of Taiwan’s rivers and reservoirs as well as among government offices responsible for water for agricultural use. 

Those responsible for the development of water resources also implement environment remediation measures when doing so, such as promoting aquatic culture水文化, incorporating fish ways and habitat restoration along rivers as well as carefully evaluating the necessity of building reservoirs.
Government agricultural offices, such as the Irrigation Agency’s Yunlin Management Office, employ engineering methods to increase retained water in irrigation waterway and the reuse of recycled water, so that each drop of water can be reused as much as tix times. 
Those in charge of reservoir management assisting farms engage in intensive farming and water conservation planning are concrete examples of the sustained use of the environment and water resources by government water resource offices.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 善用環境的大圳工事/因地制宜的嘉南大圳
sideWeb.enTitle: The Chianan Irrigation Waterway, a large-scale irrigation project that uses the local environment and methods suited to local conditions
sideWeb.zhContent:
臺灣河川坡陡流急，貯水不易。1920 年代前，嘉南平原農耕條件差，在既澇又旱的氣候條件下，15 萬甲地的人民靠看天田維生，同時有許多低窪地長期排水不佳無法農耕。八田與一技師在預算有限、水資源有限及龐大農業生產的壓力下，催生嘉南大圳及烏山頭水庫，並實行三年輪灌制度。

八田與一和一群接受西方教育的水利工程師，善用環境特色與就地取材，在雲嘉南平原建立了跨區域、跨環境的大型水圳工事 。
sideWeb.enContent:
The steep slopes and rapid flow of Taiwan’s waterways makes storing water difficult. 
Prior to the 1920s, the farming conditions of the Chianan Plain, an area prone to flooding and droughts, were poor. 
As a result, the lives of the people residing in this area, consisting of some 150,000 hectares, depended on the whims of the weather. Even worse, there were many low-lying areas with poor drainage couldn’t even be farmed. 
Faced with the tremendous pressure to increase agricultural production with a limited budget and limited water resources, an engineer by the name of Yoichi Hatta oversaw construction of the Chianan Irrigation Waterway and Wushantou Reservoir projects and implemented a three-year irrigation crop rotation system. 

Yoichi Hatta along with a group of hydraulic engineers with western-style educations made use of special features of the environment using local materials to accomplish this large-scale canal project in the Chianan Plain that crossed different regions and environmental areas.

sideWeb.zhContent:
1920 年代嘉南大圳工事推進的關鍵，是由八田與一為首的水利工事團隊，他們利用數據調查，掌握雲嘉南地形、地貌、雨量、水資源等自然條件，再配合科學技術改變自然河川的流向，讓原本只走東西向的水路，還能與南北向的人工水路串聯。

嘉南大圳之所以能提供水利，灌溉雲嘉南 15 萬甲土地，後來成為臺灣穀倉，便是濁水溪與曾文溪水聯通的結果；現今被嘉南與雲林管理處保存的史料，揭開這段工事的面紗。
sideWeb.enContent:
The key to the development of the Chianan Irrigation Waterway in the 1920s was the water resource team headed by Yoichi Hatta. 
It utilized data surveys to ascertain the topography, terrain, rainfall, water resources, and other natural conditions of the Yunlin, Chiayi, and Tainan region and employed scientific technology to change the direction of flow of the natural rivers, so that east-west oriented waterways could be linked by north-south oriented man-made waterways. 

The connecting of the Zhuoshui and Zengwen Rivers was the reason the Chianan Irrigation Waterway was able to provide water resources to irrigate 150,000 hectares of land in the Yunlin, Chiayi, and Tainan region and make it the breadbasket of Taiwan. This was learned by studying historical materials stored in the Chianan and Yunlin Management Offices.

sideWeb.zhContent: 烏山頭水庫 (日本時代稱為烏山頭貯水池) 的建造是工程師精準掌握環境地質條件的結果。烏山頭水庫位處六甲庄的淺山區，工事團隊依山勢條件規劃天然貯水池，首先是水庫選址，是選擇截斷官佃溪河道，挑選有曾文溪流經的大內地區之在地砂石資材，運到烏山頭水庫興築土水壩。原分布水庫區的聚落，包括雙溪仔、笨潭、溪仔底、圳溝仔、中崙等，於水庫完工前遷村。
sideWeb.enContent:
The Wutoushan Reservoir, known as the Wutoushan Water Storage Pond during the period of Japanese rule, is the result of engineers that constructed it having an accurate understanding of the area’s environmental and geological conditions. 
The engineering team took advantage of the terrain to make the Wutoushan Reservoir, situated in the hills of Liujiazhuang, which was a natural water holding area. 

They decided to truncate the Guandian River channel and dig gravel from Danei, an area through which the Zengwen River flows, to build the dam for the Wutoushan Reservoir. 
Villages located in the proposed reservoir area, including Shuangxizai, Bentan, Xizaidi, Zhengouzai, and Zhonglun, were relocated before work on the reservoir was completed.

sideWeb.enTitle: People dedicated to Taiwan’s water resources
sideWeb.zhContent:
當代水利工程師及農田水利管理現場所面臨的挑戰，與百年前的八田與一面臨同樣的挑戰，包括如何在施工前進行精密調查設計規劃、嚴謹的施工工序，以及完工後如何進行定期及不定期維運管理等。

嘉南大圳完成，代表八田背後一群專業水利人員共同的投入，得以在雲嘉南平原做出因地制宜、符合時代需求的水利灌溉系統。當今分屬不同單位的當代八田與一們，仍藉分工與專業知識傳承，持續為當代臺灣水資源努力。
sideWeb.enContent:
Water resource engineers and government offices responsible for irrigation today face the same challenges that Yoichi Hatta faced a century ago, including conducting precise surveys, designing, and planning before construction, adhering to rigorous standards during construction, and managing and conducting scheduled and unscheduled upkeep and maintenance on reservoirs after construction. 

The completion of the Chianan Irrigation Waterway underscores the dedication of Hatta and his team of water resource specialists and demonstrates that they were able to adapt to local conditions on the southwestern plain as they built an irrigation system that met the needs of the time. 
Today, the “Yoichi Hattas” that work in various organizations and offices have taken up the torch as they continue to employ their expertise in Taiwan’s water resources.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 從1896年追雨至今的氣象人
sideWeb.zhContent: 氣象觀測是水利建設的基礎，氣象職人的代表單位是交通部中央氣象署，掌理氣象觀測與預測；他們將所測得的雨量資訊提供給水利工程規劃用，與水利規劃的工程師互動密切。
sideWeb.enContent:
Meteorological observation is the foundation for irrigation and water resource project construction. 
Meteorologists, such as those employed by the Ministry of Transportation and Communications’ Central Weather Bureau, are responsible for making meteorological observations and predictions. 
They work closely with water resource specialists, providing them information on precipitation that engineers use in water project planning and work.

sideWeb.enTitle: Those in charge of extending the lifetime of reservoirs
sideWeb.zhContent: 水庫管理職人的代表單位是經濟部水利署南區水資源局，他們掌理北港溪以南的水資源規劃管理與水庫用水，是一群努力讓水庫延長壽命的人，他們與農田水利職人有緊密的工作交集。
sideWeb.enContent:
The Southern Region Water Resources Office, Water Resources Agency, Ministry of Economic Affairs is an example of an office responsible for reservoir management. It is responsible for the planning and management of water resources and reservoirs south of the Beigang River. 
Its staff cooperates with reservoir and irrigation specialist and works hard to extend the lifespans of reservoirs.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 不停找尋水源的水利人
sideWeb.zhContent: 水利工程職人的代表單位是經濟部水利署水利規劃試驗所，是一群不斷尋找水源、開發水源、想方設法把水留在土地上的規劃者，如同嘉南大圳規劃者八田與一及他的工事團隊，同時也是一群懂河川的規劃者，他們時常與管理河川及管理水庫的工程師一起工作。
sideWeb.enContent:
Much like Yoichi Hatta and his team planned and built the Chianan Irrigation Waterway, the Water Resources Planning Institute, Water Resources Agency, Ministry of Economic Affairs is responsible for finding and developing water resources and for finding ways to store the water on the land. 
Its members are knowledgeable river project planners and frequently work with engineers that manage rivers and reservoirs.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 管理農田水路的給水公道伯
sideWeb.enTitle: Managing the irrigation system to ensure fair distribution of water to farmlands
sideWeb.zhContent:
農田水利職人的代表單位是農業部農田水利署嘉南、雲林管理處，是負責維護嘉南大圳圳路，運用配水制度，維持公平地送水給農田灌溉。

他們與上游管理水庫的工程師及下游的農民互動密切。兩個農田水利單位也同樣管理幹、支、分線及小水路等圳路維護，並致力提高水資源的循環利用。嘉南管理處還肩負烏山頭水庫及烏山嶺取水隧道的各項安全維護。
sideWeb.enContent:
The Chianan and Yunlin Management Offices, Irrigation Agency, Ministry of Agriculture, are representative of offices responsible for irrigation projects. 
They are in charge of maintaining irrigation waterway along the Chianan Irrigation Waterway and employ a water distribution system to ensure farmlands receive water fairly. 
They work closely with reservoir engineers upstream and farmers downstream. 

The two offices are responsible for maintaining the irrigation system, including main trunks, branches, distribution waterway, and irrigation ditches and prioritize increasing the reuse of water resources. 
The Chianan Management Office bears the responsibility of the safety and maintenance of the Wutoushan Reservoir and the Wushanling water diversion tunnel.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 從共筆到共展之路：共筆雲嘉南水文化行動
sideWeb.enTitle: Rediscovering the water culture of southwestern Taiwan
sideWeb.zhContent: 2020-2023 年因嘉南大圳開工百年的契機，本館與中央部門各水利專業者組成研究團隊，針對典藏於水利機關的圖資、史料，用博物館工具及方法進行水利史料的共同研究、重返史料中呈現的田野，進行走讀、研討與考據，帶領水利人在歷史經驗與線索中，找出因應當代水資源不足的解方。
sideWeb.enContent:
To commemorate the centennial of the opening up of the Chianan Irrigation Waterway, in 2020-2023, the museum formed a museum research team with water resource experts from the central government. 
The team studies maps and historical materials stored in the water resource offices, uses museum tools and methods to conduct joint research on historical water resource materials, goes to locations indicated in the historical materials, and conducts readings, discussions, and textual research to find answers in history to water resource issues today.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 從歷史經驗找解方：水資源「再」共享
sideWeb.zhContent:
現今的農田水利署嘉南與雲林管理處，在日本時代同屬「公共埤圳嘉南大圳組合」，1963 年兩單位改組分治，管轄灌區以北港溪為界。2021 年，正值全臺大乾旱，水利及農田單位迫切找水源。

本館透過八田與一的史料引導，帶領跨域團隊重返歷史現場，尋找曾穿越北港溪河床下、卻已遭洪水沖斷的倒虹吸工輸水路，這條水路是一座連通南北水資源，即濁水溪與烏山頭水庫兩地水源的一座水利設施。

本館與水利人共同反思日本時代水源連通與調度思維，2022 年水利署以倒虹吸工使水資源共享的「精神」，提出新設渡槽橋以連通雲林及嘉南水資源，獲行政院核定執行，預計 2025 年完工，有助紓解臺灣南部缺水困境。
sideWeb.enContent:
The Chianan and Yunlin Management Offices, Irrigation Agency of today were part of the Public Chianan Irrigation Channel Cooperative Office during the period of Japanese governance. 
In a reorganization carried out in in 1963, the offices were split up and given different areas of jurisdiction with the Beigang River serving as the line of demarcation. 
In 2021, a time when Taiwan was faced with a major drought, offices responsible for water resources and agricultural lands were urgently seeking new sources of water. 

Guided by historical materials by Yoichi Hatta, the museum sent its interdisciplinary team back to the site to locate the inverted siphon waterway that passed under the Beigang River bed. 
This waterway connected the Zhoushui River in the north with the Wutoushan Reservoir in the south, but it was later damaged by floods. 

The museum and water resource specialists reflected on how water resources were connected and distributed during the period of Japanese rule and, in 2022, the Irrigation Agency proposed a new aqueduct bridge in the “spirit” of an inversed siphon to share water resources to connect water resources in Yunlin and Chianan. 
Approved by the government and scheduled for completion in 2025, it is expected to help relieve water shortages in southern Taiwan.

sideWeb.zhContent:
當代水利系統是歷代水資源、水利工程與環境不斷整合的結果。受西方科學技術影響，突破地形限制，將小區域的埤圳水源，先整併成區域水利系統，再整併成跨區域、跨環境的水利系統；當代氣候變遷下，淹水或乾旱已非區域問題，因著水使社會成為生命共同體。簡言之，水共構了水環境，水環境繫住土地上的每個生命。

本展是公部門從共學、共筆到共展，加入教育與公民團體共同的研究成果。2023 年底，本館帶著水利、農田、學校與公民等八個單位，將水利知識轉化為現地共展，豐富臺灣水文化內涵，並加入國立臺北藝術大學博物館研究所師生協力策展。期待以產官學合作，呼籲社會重視氣候變遷及水環境變遷，使臺灣成為一座居安思危的島嶼。
sideWeb.enContent:
Today’s irrigation system is the result of the continuous integration of water resources, water resource engineering, and the environment over the years. 
Employing western science and technology, we were able to overcome topographical restrictions, advance from ponds and waterway on a local scale, integrate them into regional irrigation systems, then into irrigations systems that cross regions and environments. 
Under the influence of climate change, floods and droughts are not just local issues, because water makes us a community of life. Simply put, water is fundamental to the environment and connects all life.

This exhibition is the result of the shared efforts of government offices collaborating in research, writing, and setting up and working with education and civic organizations. 
In late 2023, the museum and eight groups, including water resource, agricultural, academic, and civic organizations, will present knowledge related to water resources in the form of an exhibition to contribute to the enrichment of Taiwan’s water culture. 
In addition, the faculty and students of the Taipei National University of the Arts’ Graduate Institute of Museum Studies will help in curating the exhibition. 
We look forward to this collaboration between industry, government, and academia and call on everyone to recognize the impact of climate change and changes in the water environment, so that Taiwan can be prepared to deal with any contingency.

sideWeb.zhTitle: 追水行動：史料帶路的田野路
sideWeb.zhContent: 2020年，本館於農田水利署雲林管理處的農田水利文物陳列館中，發現大正7年有八田與一署名的《官佃溪埤圳工事說明書》，並為農田水利署嘉南管理處整理了4,500多件的水利史料物件，豐富的史料素材，支持了水文化團隊開啟追著大圳水路跑的田野計畫，進行史料的田野考證解讀，在「國家文化記憶庫」中發表《從水頭到水尾》的嘉南大圳影音素材，並與水利人共同以故事地圖平台，集結歷史與水利科普的水文化知識，發表《大圳學學》數位刊物，建構臺灣水文化地方知識平台，包括歷史人文、水文觀測、河川治理到農田灌溉等內容，建立臺灣水文化地方知識的公共化。
sideWeb.enContent:
In 2020, the NMTHdiscovered in the Yunlin Management Office’s Irrigation Channel   Conservancy Cultural Relics Exhibition Hall a document dated 1918 and signed by Yoichi Hatta titled Instructions for Guandian River Ponds and Channel 官佃溪埤圳工事說明書 and sorted through over 4,500 documents dealing with water resources found at the Chianan Management Office. 

The historical materials proved invaluable to the water cultural team in the carrying out of its field project as it followed the irrigation waterways, conducted field research, and interpreted historical materials.
The museum published “From the Beginning to the End of the Water,” a video about the Chianan Irrigation Waterway, and uploaded it into the National Cultural Memory Bank. 

The museum worked with water resource experts to use a story map platform to gather knowledge of water culture that incorporates history and water resource science and published the digital publication Learning in Water to build a platform for local knowledge of water culture in Taiwan, including history and culture, hydrological observation and measurement, river management, and farm irrigation, to build a pool of local knowledge on Taiwan’s water culture.

info.zhTitle: 昭和 3 年 ( 1928 ) 北港地區輪作
info.zhContent:
雲林因直接引用濁水溪開始實施灌溉，是嘉南大圳工事中最早成功施行三年輪灌的實驗地區。特別崙背支線屬於嘉南大圳濁幹線系統，於 1924 年完工通水，灌區為崙背與二崙、麥寮等新虎尾溪以北的地區，是嘉南大圳最早通水、最早實行三年輪作制的區域。

info.zhTitle: 昭和 14 年 ( 1939年 ) 曾文溪貯水池位置圖
info.zhContent:
嘉南大圳完成時，八田與一已未雨綢繆預測日後烏山頭水庫會面臨貯水不足的窘境，因此指派工事團隊的宮地末彥提出在曾文溪上游處建議設立曾文溪貯水池規劃構想，是日後的曾文水庫。嘉南大圳工事現代科學技術使水路遍及臺南州(雲嘉南)各地，最重要的是嘉南大圳水源整合了濁水溪、曾文溪兩大水源，加上烏山頭貯水池，使水資源得以按年進行調度，而有三年輪灌制度的產生。
